result.execSummary:
The defendant Antoine Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: IF REVOKED: 1 day sentence credit granted

miscConds.notes:
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended

Absolute sobriety, random UA's

No use or possession of controlled substances or drug paraphernalia

No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription

Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by agent

Court costs and DNA surcharge to be paid as a condition of probation

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Complete 50 hours of community service at agent's direction
CONDITION TIME - Huber with release for work and school - STAYED - to be used at agent's discretion, agent to determine with or without non-working hours

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Antoine Williams

records.addlTxt:
2:26 PM Defendant Antoine Williams in court.  Attorney John M Binder in court for Antoine Williams.  Prosecuting attorney Alyssa M. Schaller in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 
Court conducts a plea colloquy with defendant. 
Defendant enters a plea of guilty to Count 2. 
Court finds the defendant guilty to Count 2 striking repeater. 
Court dismisses and reads in Counts 1, 3 and 4. 

Court orders the following:
Withheld
1 day credit if revoked
STAYED for PROBATION

Term of Probation: 18 MONTHS
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION: 
 50 hours of Community Service 
 AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
 Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.'s ; 
 No Use or Possession of controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
 No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
 Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent; 
 DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
 
COSTS:  $268.00
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $250.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

CONDITION TIME: 90 Days Waukesha County Jail with Huber, release for work and school STAYED; to be used at agent's discretion.  Agent to determine with or without non working hours.  

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Elements/Jury Instructions filed by Atty. John Binder
Character letter filed - R.V.
Defendant's sentencing memorandum

2:34 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder.
Defendant Antoine Williams in court.  Attorney John M Binder in court for Antoine Williams. 
Atty Binder requests one further plea and sentencing date as the discovery issue has just been resolved. 
State has no comment.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 5, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 6, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

01:33 PM Defendant Antoine Williams in court with attorney John M Binder.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Hearing on July 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

09:40 AM Defendant Antoine Williams in court with attorney John M Binder.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Binder requests further discovery in this matter and a new date. 
State does not object.  Hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Hearing on June 20, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

08:18 AM Defendant Antoine Williams in court with attorney John M Binder.  Jack A. Pitzo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 20, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

09:03 AM Defendant Antoine Williams in court with attorney John M Binder.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Charlie Hoffmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 20, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
